item.title: Please help me portfoward my server :)
item.dc:creator: @kthillman kthillman
item.description:
@kthillman wrote:

TRY THIS!
1st) Open I.E. and in address bar type “192.168.1.1” or “127.0.0.0” or “0.0.0.0”
2nd) Enter in your routers SSID and PASSWORD SET
3rd) Find the tab saying “portfowarding”
4th) In the first blank box type ya servers port and select BOTH for the types (tcp & udp)
5th) SAVE AND COMPLETE

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me portfoward my server :)

item.title: Please help me portfoward my server :)
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Zack_of_Pwnage Owner Zack of PwnageScape
item.description:
@Owner_Zack_of_Pwnage wrote:

Uhmm…
There are many ways to do this, and like he pointed out, there are multiple tutorials. I’ll give you a basic way to portforward (Or atleast what I think it is).

  1. Go to you CMD, and type in ipconfig.
  2. Scroll down, until you see “Default Gateway”, and there will be some numbers after that.
  3. Type those numbers into your web browser.
  4. It will ask you for a User and Password, and according to your router you have to enter in your password.
  5. After that, on the left side, you should see something called “Portforwarding and Triggering”
  6. Click that, and click “New” or whatever it says.
  7. Make the start and end port 43594, and name it RSPS.
  8. Make sure you enable that port.
  9. And you now have Portforwarded.

Remember, you should probably set up a no-ip for people to connect to you. If you want to check if it worked, try logging into your server with the IP of 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help me portfoward my server :)
